title.rendered: 5 Phone Safety Tips & Apps for Photographers

content.rendered:
As a photographer, it’s important to keep your Android smartphone safe & and equipped with the best apps at all times. This is important whether you’re out shooting a client or editing photos at home! There are many apps and tools to keep you and your device stacked with the best tools, but here’s our list of the best apps you need as a pro photographer.

Install Dumpster to Back Up Photos

Dumpster is a free photo & video recovery tool available for download on the Google Play Store! If you don’t have a phone backup, this is the exact app you need. By having Dumpster installed on your device, you won’t ever accidentally delete any photos, videos, or other types of content you have stored on your device. 

No one ever regretted having a free backup on their device. 

Use Noonlight to Stay Protected

Noonlight is one of the best personal safety apps available on both Android and iOS. The app uses cutting-edge technology to send emergency help to your exact location with just the release of a button. 

It’s perfect for busy photographers because the app can be used in moments where you feel unsafe, or worse case scenarios where you need immediate emergency help. 

Store Passwords with Dashlane

As a photographer, you probably use many apps. Some for photo storage, finances, maps, transportation, messages, social media, and the list goes on. Surprisingly, one of easiest ways to keep your device secure is to keep track of the passwords you use. 

With Dashlane, you can store an unlimited number of passwords and access them anywhere, sync data, create new heavy-duty secure passwords, and so much more. 

Keep Track of Payments with Wave

The hardest thing about being an independent photographer or freelancer isn’t the work itself ー it’s managing your finances!

If you need to keep better tabs on who owes you what, or need help organizing payments & invoices in a central place, Wave is exactly the app you need. It’s great to have for managing clients as well as keeping track of all of your records for tax season.

Check Citizen Before Confirming Shoot Locations

Citizen is an app that notifies you of real-time safety alerts and live video of incidents happening around you. Citizen notifications have urged people to evacuate burning buildings, deterred school buses from nearby terrorist attacks and have even led to a rescue of a 1-year-old from a stolen car.

Before you and your client visit your shoot location, it’s in your best interest to ensure the location is safe. You’re better off safe than sorry, especially if you’re located in a metro area.

Download Dumpster the #1 Photo & Video Recovery Tool Today!
